groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <I>Understanding Society, Wave 3, 2011-2012: Teaching Dataset</I> is a cut-down version of the full <I>Understanding Society</I> Wave 3 data. <I>Understanding Society</I>, or the United Kingdom Household Longitudinal Study (UKHLS), began in 2009 and is a multi-topic household survey, the purpose of which is to understand social and economic change in Britain at the household and individual levels. This teaching dataset is designed to be used in teaching quantitative social sciences and for student reports. It consists of a selection of variables from the Wave 3 individual questionnaire, with added household-level variables and is designed for individual level analyses.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered in the teaching dataset include family, occupation, neighbourhood, membership of organisations, health, social networks, personality, cognitive ability, and household information.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2011-01-01T00:00:00Z">January 2011</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2013-07-01T00:00:00Z">July 2013</collDate>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Respondents to Wave 3 of <i>Understanding Society</i> (see SN 6614). See documentation for further details.</universe>         <dataKind>Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>(based on the <i>Understanding Society</i> longitudinal study but using only Wave 3 information and weights).</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>See documentation for SN 6614 for details of <i>Understanding Society</i> sampling, and the documentation for this study for details of sampling used for the teaching dataset.</sampProc>         <deviat>45,903 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <collMode>For more information about data collection for the main <i>Understanding Society</i> study, see documentation for SN 6614.</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>See SN 6614, <I>Understanding Society</I>.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.
